intro: Scorzonera villosa, commonly known as the hairy scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features a robust, taproot system that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length, making it a notable species in its habitat. Its leaves are hairy and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its common name. Scorzonera villosa typically blooms with yellow to orange flowers in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
